description: CEFR B1 핵심 문법 - 현재완료, 조건문, 수동태

grammarPoints.name: present_perfect
grammarPoints.explanation: Use present perfect for past actions with present relevance.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 과거의 행동이 현재와 관련이 있을 때 현재완료를 사용해요.

examples.en: I have lived here for 5 years.
She has already finished.
Have you ever been to Japan?
They haven't arrived yet.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: '~해왔다/~한 적 있다'에 해당해요. for(기간), since(시점), ever, never, already, yet과 자주 쓰여요.

grammarPoints.name: first_conditional
grammarPoints.explanation: Use first conditional for real/possible future situations.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 실현 가능한 미래 상황을 표현할 때 조건문 1형을 사용해요.

examples.en: If it rains, I will stay home.
If you study hard, you'll pass.
I won't go if you don't come.
examples.ko: 네가 안 오면 나도 안 갈 거야.

examples.en: What will you do if you win?

grammarPoints.koreanTip: '만약 ~하면 ~할 것이다'에 해당해요. if절은 현재, 주절은 will을 써요.

commonErrors.wrong: If it will rain, I stay.
commonErrors.correct: If it rains, I will stay.

commonErrors.wrong: If you will come, I be happy.
commonErrors.correct: If you come, I will be happy.

grammarPoints.name: second_conditional
grammarPoints.explanation: Use second conditional for unreal/hypothetical situations.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 비현실적이거나 가정적인 상황을 표현할 때 조건문 2형을 사용해요.

examples.en: If I had money, I would travel.
If she were here, she'd help.
What would you do if you won?
I wouldn't do that if I were you.
examples.ko: 내가 너라면 그렇게 안 할 거야.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: '만약 ~라면 ~할 텐데'에 해당해요. 현재 사실과 반대되는 가정이에요.

grammarPoints.name: passive_voice
grammarPoints.explanation: Use passive when the action is more important than who did it.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 누가 했는지보다 행동 자체가 더 중요할 때 수동태를 사용해요.

examples.en: English is spoken worldwide.
The book was written in 1920.
The meeting will be held tomorrow.
Mistakes were made.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: '~되다/~당하다'에 해당해요. by + 행위자로 누가 했는지 표현할 수 있어요.

grammarPoints.name: reported_speech
grammarPoints.explanation: Use reported speech to relay what someone said.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 누군가 말한 것을 전달할 때 간접화법을 사용해요.

examples.en: He said he was tired.
She told me she would come.
They asked if I was okay.
He asked what time it was.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 간접화법에서는 시제가 한 단계 뒤로 가요 (is→was, will→would).

grammarPoints.name: relative_clauses
grammarPoints.explanation: Use relative clauses to give more information about a noun.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 명사에 대한 추가 정보를 줄 때 관계절을 사용해요.

examples.en: The man who called is my brother.
The book which I bought is great.
That's the restaurant where we met.
The girl whose bag was lost is crying.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 관계대명사는 두 문장을 연결해 줘요. 사람은 who, 사물은 which, 장소는 where.

grammarPoints.name: used_to
grammarPoints.explanation: Use 'used to' for past habits or states that no longer exist.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 더 이상 존재하지 않는 과거 습관이나 상태를 표현할 때 'used to'를 사용해요.

examples.en: I used to live in Seoul.
She used to play tennis.
Did you use to smoke?
I didn't use to like coffee.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: '~하곤 했다/~였었다'에 해당해요. 지금은 더 이상 아닌 과거 상태예요.

grammarPoints.name: modals_possibility
grammarPoints.explanation: Use might, may, could to express possibility.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 가능성을 표현할 때 might, may, could를 사용해요.

examples.en: It might rain tomorrow.
She may be at home.
He could be right.
They might not come.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 확실성 순서: will > should > may > might/could. might가 가장 불확실해요.

grammarPoints.name: present_perfect_continuous
grammarPoints.explanation: Use present perfect continuous for actions that started in the past and continue now.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 과거에 시작해서 지금까지 계속되는 행동을 표현할 때 사용해요.

examples.en: I've been waiting for an hour.
She's been studying all day.
Have you been exercising?
It's been raining since morning.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: '~해 오고 있다'에 해당해요. 진행의 지속을 강조해요.

grammarPoints.name: too_enough
grammarPoints.explanation: Use too and enough to express degree.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 정도를 표현할 때 too와 enough를 사용해요.

examples.en: It's too expensive.
Is it warm enough?
I don't have enough money.
You're too young to drive.
